title: [Large-Scale] Social Constructivist-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Project for Knowledge Sharing and Organizational Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational math understanding and online learning platform proficiency
context.additional_context: Course for office/administrative professionals to enhance knowledge management and organizational learning competencies in mathematical problem-solving processes. Establishes a culture of tacit knowledge sharing through asynchronous collaboration

learning_goals: Learners enhance their ability to collaborate with peers and share knowledge to solve complex mathematical problems.

In a 6-month long-term project-based assessment, learners can design three knowledge management strategies suitable for organizational learning environments (e.g., research teams, cross-functional teams), and submit a report achieving an average of at least 4 out of 5 points on peer and instructor evaluation criteria (clarity, feasibility, innovativeness).

Applying sociocultural constructivist principles (e.g., collaborative knowledge-building, reflective dialogue) on an online discussion board, learners can provide at least three specific feedbacks per week on peersâ€™ mathematical ideas and write a 500-word reflective summary of their own thinking processes based on the discussions.

resources: Digital collaboration tools (shared documents, video conferencing)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
